title: Sanjay Leela Bhansali Opens Up About His Temper On Set: 'What Is Wrong In It...'
text: - By [Srishti Pandey](/authors/srishti-pandey) - Published: Sun, 26 May 2024 01:09 AM (IST) - Source:JND Sanjay Leela Bhansali, the renowned Bollywood director known for his visually stunning and emotionally rich films, recently addressed his reputation for being a strict taskmaster on set. In a recent interview, Bhansali defended his occasional temper outbursts, emphasizing his commitment to his craft and the high standards he sets for himself and his team. Bhansali, who made his streaming debut with the Netflix series 'Heeramandi: The Diamond Bazaar,' expressed his view that filmmaking is a demanding art that requires dedication and focus. He highlighted the importance of punctuality and professionalism, stating that he arrives on set early and expects the same from his actors and technicians. Bhansali explained that his long takes and lengthy shots can be challenging for his team, but he believes in pushing them to deliver their best work. Regarding his reputation for having a temper, Bhansali stated, “If I’m not getting what I want, even if I lose my temper, what is wrong in it? If you’re not getting a shot, and if someone is spoiling it, what will you do?” He clarified that while he may get upset at times, he always tries to maintain a respectful and collaborative environment on set. Despite his occasional outbursts, Bhansali emphasized that he deeply cares for his actors and technicians, often pampering them and creating a bond that makes them want to work with him again. He believes that the final product is what truly matters, not the challenges faced during production or any rumours about his behaviour. 'Heeramandi: The Diamond Bazaar' is set against the backdrop of a prominent red-light district in the 1940s and explores the lives of courtesans and nawabs. The series features a star-studded cast, including Manisha Koirala, Sonakshi Sinha, Aditi Rao Hydari, Richa Chadha, Sanjeeda Sheikh, and Sharmin Segal.
